testInfo.name: Gesamtfragenkatalog zum Test „Leben in Deutschland“ und zum „Einbürgerungstest“

questions.germanQuestion: Welches Wappen gehört zum Bundesland Baden-Württemberg?
questions.englishQuestion: Which coat of arms belongs to the state of Baden-Württemberg?
questions.notes: The coat of arms of Baden-Württemberg is an important symbol representing the state.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on identifying the unique elements of the Baden-Württemberg coat of arms.

resources.description: Learn more about the coat of arms of Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Welches ist ein Landkreis in Baden-Württemberg?
questions.englishQuestion: Which is a district (Landkreis) in Baden-Württemberg?
questions.notes: The 'Neckar-Odenwald-Kreis' is a district located in the state of Baden-Württemberg.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the names of districts within Baden-Württemberg, especially 'Neckar-Odenwald-Kreis.'

resources.description: Learn more about the districts in Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Für wie viele Jahre wird der Landtag in Baden-Württemberg gewählt?
questions.englishQuestion: For how many years is the state parliament (Landtag) in Baden-Württemberg elected?
questions.notes: The state parliament in Baden-Württemberg is elected for a term of 5 years.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the term length for the Landtag in Baden-Württemberg is 5 years, aligning with most other German federal states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political system in Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Ab welchem Alter darf man in Baden-Württemberg bei Kommunalwahlen wählen?
questions.englishQuestion: At what age can you vote in local elections in Baden-Württemberg?
questions.notes: In Baden-Württemberg, citizens can participate in local elections starting at the age of 16.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that 16 is the voting age for local elections in Baden-Württemberg, allowing young citizens to engage in their community's political process.

resources.description: Learn more about voting rights in Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Farben hat die Landesflagge von Baden-Württemberg?
questions.englishQuestion: What are the colors of the state flag of Baden-Württemberg?
questions.notes: The state flag of Baden-Württemberg consists of the colors black and gold.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember the black and gold colors of Baden-Württemberg's flag, which reflect the state's heritage.

resources.description: Learn more about the flag of Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Wo können Sie sich in Baden-Württemberg über politische Themen informieren?
questions.englishQuestion: Where can you get information on political topics in Baden-Württemberg?

options.germanOption: bei der Landeszentrale für politische Bildung
options.englishOption: at the State Center for Civic Education

questions.notes: In Baden-Württemberg, the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' (State Center for Civic Education) is the key institution for learning about political topics.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on the role of the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' in educating the public about political matters in Baden-Württemberg.

resources.description: Learn more about the State Center for Civic Education in Baden-Württemberg.

questions.englishQuestion: The state capital of Baden-Württemberg is called …
questions.notes: The state capital of Baden-Württemberg is Stuttgart, a major city known for its automotive industry and cultural heritage.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that Stuttgart is not only the capital of Baden-Württemberg but also a key economic hub in Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about Stuttgart, the capital of Baden-Württemberg.

questions.notes: Baden-Württemberg is located in the southwest of Germany and is one of the country's 16 federal states.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the geographical location of Baden-Württemberg on a map of Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about the geography of Baden-Württemberg.

questions.germanQuestion: Wie nennt man die Regierungschefin/den Regierungschef in Baden-Württemberg?
questions.englishQuestion: What is the title of the head of government in Baden-Württemberg?
questions.notes: The head of government in Baden-Württemberg is called the 'Ministerpräsidentin' or 'Ministerpräsident,' a title equivalent to 'Minister-President.'
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the title 'Ministerpräsident' is used for the heads of government in German federal states, including Baden-Württemberg.

resources.description: Learn more about the role of the Minister-President in Germany.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Ministerin/welchen Minister hat Baden-Württemberg nicht?
questions.englishQuestion: Which minister does Baden-Württemberg not have?
questions.notes: Baden-Württemberg, like other German federal states, does not have a Foreign Minister ('Außenminister'), as foreign affairs are handled at the federal level.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that federal states in Germany do not have foreign ministers, as foreign policy is the responsibility of the federal government.

resources.description: Learn more about the structure of state governments in Germany.
